summary: The General Services Administration spends hundreds of millions of dollars annually to build or modernize federal offices, courthouses, and other buildings. We found GSA routinely meets its cost and schedule goals, but it does not report the projects’ final costs or how much project costs and schedules were revised. Also, GSA evaluates whether projects meet design standards and tenant needs, but it lacks guidance for...
title: Federal Buildings: GSA Can Improve Its Communication about and Assessment of Major Construction Projects
